DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Post Therapeutic Procedure Iobenguane I-131 Imaging Technique Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the date post-therapy I-131 MIBG scan was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Post Therapeutic Procedure Iobenguane I-131 Imaging Technique Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An I 131 radioiodinated synthetic analogue of the neurotransmitter norepinephrine. Iobenguane localizes to adrenergic tissue and, in radioiodinated forms, may be used to image or eradicate tumor cells that take up and metabolize norepinephrine._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Post Therapeutic Procedure Iobenguane I-131 Imaging Technique Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An I 131 radioiodinated synthetic analogue of the neurotransmitter norepinephrine. Iobenguane localizes to adrenergic tissue and, in radioiodinated forms, may be used to image or eradicate tumor cells that take up and metabolize norepinephrine.:Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

An I 131 radioiodinated synthetic analogue of the neurotransmitter norepinephrine. Iobenguane localizes to adrenergic tissue and, in radioiodinated forms, may be used to image or eradicate tumor cells that take up and metabolize norepinephrine.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Workflow and Registration Status Changed per Brenda Duggan; 05.16.18; reviewed and released DEC 12/22/2021

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A particular date on which an imaging study is conducted.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
